Sentence.sentence: Perhaps there is less to fight about, with the country in a period of tranquility and the dangers of drug abuse and other unwholesome behavior well known.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Currently, there’s mounting criticism of Michelle Obama’s Let’s Move campaign, which fights childhood obesity by encouraging youngsters to become more physically active, and it signed on singer Beyonce and basketball player Shaquille O’Neal, both of whom also endorse sodas which are a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The power of such simple psychology in fighting climate change is attracting attention across the political establishment.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Politicians are beginning to realise the importance of enlisting psychologists' help in fighting climate change.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The fight for racial and economic equality is intensely pragmatic (讲求实用的) and immediate in its impact.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Despite the modesty of the benefit, the Chamber of Commerce and other business groups fought it bitterly, describing it as "government-run personnel management" and a "dangerous precedent".
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Indians likewise had the traditional life taken from them by white settlers who often encourage them to consume alcohol to prevent them from fighting back.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: To stop them from fighting back
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: If you do lose your job, the union will fight to get it back for you along with back pay—your lost income.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "The project has two sides," says Xavier Serrat, Neurice project manager and researcher at the University of Barcelona,"the short-term fight against the snail, and a mid- to long-term fight against climate change.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Efforts like painting eyes on cow butts may seem crazy at first, but they could make actual headway in the fight for conservation.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Then, when we try to have that amazing work session in fight, we get nothing done.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"战斗，战争"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: battle, war, campaign, struggle, warfare, fight, combat, engagement
means: battle ： 侧重指战争中的一次较全面、时间较长的战斗，也指陆军或海军在某一特定地区进行的战斗，或个人之间的争斗。
war ： 是战争的总称，一般指包括多个战役的大规模战争。
campaign ： 通常指在一场大的战争中在某一地区进行的一连串有既定目的的军事行动。也可作引申用。
struggle ： 指激烈或时间持续长的战斗或奋力斗争。
warfare ： 侧重指战争状态或具体的作战方法。
fight ： 最普通用词，含义广，指战斗、斗争或打斗。
combat ： 泛指军事行动，尤指小规模的战斗，甚至是格斗。

example.en: He fought a bottle all evening after he was told that his girlfriend would be married to another young man.
example.zh: 他得知他的女友将与另一青年人结婚的消息后，他猛喝了一晚上的酒。

Sentence.sentence: According to the author, polluting industries should fight against carbon pollution.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 题设

Sentence.sentence: Attached was a recording, a recording of loss and love, of the fight.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But when I arrived at the check-in desk at providence, the lady on the desk said: "well, I'm really sorry, I've got some bad news for you-there are no fights from Washington.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I guess the answer is, we were fighting for survival, protecting and providing for those we loved.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: Misery inspires a man to fight against his fate.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: On the last Wednesday of every August, the Spanish town of Bunol hosts Ea Tomatina—the world's largest food fight.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Pheromones can signal that an animal is either ready to fight or is feeling open to partnerships.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Risk-takers were better at hunting, fighting, or exploring.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: She intends to fight to make it a woman's as well as a man's world.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The battle lasts little more than half an hour, in which time around 50, 000 kilograms of tomatoes have been thrown at anyone or anything that moves, runs, or fights back.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The early morning sees the arrival of large trucks with tomatoes—official fight-starters get things going by casting tomatoes at the crowd.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The plants get ready to fight back.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: There can be a busy executive who fights to keep to his schedule.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: This trend, which was started by the medical community as a method of fighting heart disease, has had some unintended side effects such as overweight and heart disease--the very thing the medical community was trying to fight.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Transparent animals use different tricks to fight scattering.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Travelers have traditionally fought this problem with sleeping pills or alcohol.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 完形填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Even though there is plenty of evidence that the quality of the teachers is the most important variable, teachers’ unions have fought against getting rid of bad ones and promoting good ones.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One could interpret much of the work of Beethoven by saying that suffering is inevitable, but the courage to fight it renders life worth living.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: Forests give us shade, quiet and one of the harder challenges in the fight against climate change.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: If we readjust our view of arguments—from a verbal fight or tennis game to a reasoned exchange through which we all gain mutual respect, and understanding—then we change the very nature of what it means to "win" an argument.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: If you see a conversation as a fight or competition, you can win by cheating as long as you don't get caught.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

sentences.en: He fought his bravest (war).
sentences.cn: 他打得最勇敢。

sentences.en: When dogs fight, they use their teeth.
sentences.cn: 狗打架时用牙齿。

sentences.en: You can fight him, but can you beat him?
sentences.cn: 你可以打他, 但是你能击败他吗?

sentences.en: Jim was able to hold back his anger and avoid a fight.
sentences.cn: 吉姆总算抑制住了愤怒, 从而避免了一场殴斗。

sentences.en: They are determined to persevere in the fight.
sentences.cn: 他们决心坚持战斗。

sentences.en: The fight against drug abuse goes on.
sentences.cn: 反对吸毒的斗争在继续。

sentences.en: There's not much fight left in him now.
sentences.cn: 他现在已没多少斗志了。</seg>

data.mean: 战斗（尤指为夺取某一地方或位置）

fixed_phrase_list.cn: 与...并肩战斗；为反对...而战斗

sentence.cn: 我想答案是，我们在为生存而战，为保护和养活我们所爱的人而战。
sentence.en: I guess the answer is,  we were fighting for survival,  protecting and providing for those we loved.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读表达 原文

sentence.cn: 她打算努力使它成为一个女人的和男人的世界。
sentence.en: She intends to fight to make it a woman’s as well as a man’s world.
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: be fated to fail in one's efforts

lj.lj_ly: he was fighting a losing battle to stem the tears.
lj.lj_ls: 他徒劳地想要止住泪水。

jx.jx_en_mean: put up a spirited show of resistance in a fight or contest

lj.lj_ly: United certainly made a fight of it in the second half.
lj.lj_ls: 毫无疑问，联队在下半场奋起抵抗了。

jx.jx_en_mean: the instinctive physiological response to a threatening situation, which readies one either to resist forcibly or to run away
jx.jx_cn_mean: 或进或退；要么拼搏，要么逃走

jx.jx_en_mean: counter-attack or retaliate in a fight, struggle, or contest
settle a dispute by fighting or competing aggressively

lj.lj_ly: they fought it out with a tug-of-war.
lj.lj_ls: 他们通过激烈的竞争来解决问题。

jx.jx_en_mean: (fight someone/thing off)defend oneself against an attack by someone or something

lj.lj_ly: well-fed people are better able to fight off infectious disease.
lj.lj_ls: 营养充足的人更能抵抗传染病。

jx.jx_en_mean: To defend against or drive back (a hostile force, for example).
jx.jx_cn_mean: 抵抗，击退：防御或击退（例如一股敌对势力）

jx.jx_en_mean: To combat one evil or one set of negative circumstances by reacting in kind.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以毒攻毒：在与邪恶或反动势力作斗争时以其人之道还制其人是身

entry.def: If you fight something unpleasant, you try in a determined way to prevent it or stop it happening.

example.ex: Mother Teresa is an elderly nun who has devoted her life to fighting poverty...
example.tran: 德肋撒嬷嬷是一位毕生致力于消除贫困事业的年迈修女。

example.ex: More units to fight forest fires are planned...
example.tran: 计划设立更多单位防控森林火灾。

entry.def: If you fight for something, you try in a determined way to get it or achieve it.

example.ex: Our Government should be fighting for an end to food subsidies...
example.tran: 我们政府应该努力废止食物补贴。

example.ex: Lee had to fight hard for his place on the expedition...
example.tran: 李不得不为在考察队中获得一席之地而苦苦争取。

entry.def: If an army or group fights a battle with another army or group, they oppose each other with weapons. You can also say that two armies or groups fight a battle.

example.ex: The two men fought a battle over land and water rights...
example.tran: 这两个男人为土地和水的使用权发生了争斗。

example.ex: In the latest incident at the weekend police fought a gun battle with a gang which used hand grenades against them...
example.tran: 在周末发生的最近一起暴力事件中，警方与向他们投掷手榴弹的一伙匪徒展开了枪战。

entry.def: If a person or army fights in a battle or a war, they take part in it.

example.ex: He fought in the war and was taken prisoner by the Americans...
example.tran: 他参了战，后被美国人俘虏。

example.ex: If I were a young man I would sooner go to prison than fight for this country...
example.tran: 如果我是个年轻人，我宁愿进监狱也不愿为这个国家打仗。

entry.def: If one person fights with another, or fights them, the two people hit or kick each other because they want to hurt each other. You can also say that two people fight .

example.ex: As a child she fought with her younger sister...
example.tran: 她小时候会和妹妹打架。

example.ex: I did fight him, I punched him but it was like hitting a wall...
example.tran: 我确实和他打了起来，我挥拳向他猛击，但就像打在墙上一样。

entry.def: If one person fights with another, or fights them, they have an angry disagreement or quarrel. You can also say that two people fight .

example.ex: She was always arguing with him and fighting with him...
example.tran: 她总是跟他争辩吵嘴。

example.ex: Gwendolen started fighting her teachers...
example.tran: 格温德琳开始同老师争执起来。

entry.def: If you fight your way to a place, you move towards it with great difficulty, for example because there are a lot of people or obstacles in your way.

example.ex: I fought my way into a carriage just before the doors closed...
example.tran: 我刚挤进车厢，车门就关上了。

example.ex: Peter fought his way through a blizzard to save one of the chickens.
example.tran: 彼得为了救其中一只鸡在暴风雪中艰难前行。

entry.def: A fight is a boxing match.

example.ex: This was Hyer's last fight, for no one else challenged him...
example.tran: 这是海尔的最后一场比赛，因为再没有人向他发起挑战。

example.ex: The referee stopped the fight.
example.tran: 裁判叫停了比赛。

entry.def: To fight means to take part in a boxing match.

example.ex: In a few hours' time one of the world's most famous boxers will be fighting in Britain for the first time...
example.tran: 几个小时后，世界最著名的拳击手之一将开始其在英国的首场比赛。

example.ex: I'd like to fight him because he's undefeated and I want to be the first man to beat him...
example.tran: 我想和他对阵，因为他从没有输过，而我想成为打败他的第一人。

entry.def: If you fight an election, you are a candidate in the election and try to win it.

example.ex: The former party treasurer helped raise almost £40 million to fight the election campaign.
example.tran: 该党的前任财政部长帮助筹集了近 4,000 万英镑用于竞选。

entry.def: You can use fight to refer to a contest such as an election or a sports match.

example.ex: ...the fight for power between the two parties.
example.tran: 两党间的权力之争

entry.def: If you fight a case or a court action, you make a legal case against someone in a very determined way, or you put forward a defence when a legal case is made against you.
entry.tran: 进行(诉讼、辩护等);打(官司)

example.ex: Watkins sued the Army and fought his case in various courts for 10 years...
example.tran: 沃特金斯将军队诉至法院，并在各级法庭打了 10 年的官司。

example.ex: The newspaper is fighting a damages action brought by the actress.
example.tran: 这家报纸正和提起损害赔偿诉讼的女演员对簿公堂。

entry.def: Fight is the desire or ability to keep fighting.

example.ex: I thought that we had a lot of fight in us.
example.tran: 我觉得我们斗志高昂。

entry.def: If you fight an emotion or desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it, but do not always succeed.
entry.tran: 努力克制，竭力抑制(感情或欲望)

example.ex: I desperately fought the urge to giggle...
example.tran: 我拼命地想忍住笑。

example.ex: He fought with the urge to smoke one of the cigars he'd given up awhile ago...
example.tran: 他努力克制自己的烟瘾，不去抽一支戒掉没多久的雪茄。

entry.def: If you fight for breath, you try to breathe but find it very difficult.
If you have a fighting chance of doing or achieving something, it is possible that you will do or achieve it, but only if you make a great effort or are very lucky.
entry.tran: 经过努力才能成功的机会;需要极大好运的机会

example.ex: When they didn't shoot at me right away, I figured I had a fighting chance.
example.tran: 当他们没有立即向我开枪时，我估摸自己还有一线生机。

entry.def: If you describe someone as fighting fit, you are emphasizing that they are very fit or healthy.

example.ex: After a good night's sleep I feel fighting fit again.
example.tran: 昨夜睡得很香，我又觉得自己精力充沛了。

entry.def: Someone who is fighting for their life is making a great effort to stay alive, either when they are being physically attacked or when they are very ill.
entry.tran: 与死神殊死搏斗;奋力求生

example.ex: He is still fighting for his life in hospital.
example.tran: 他仍在医院与死神搏斗。

entry.def: If you fight back against someone or something that is attacking or harming you, you resist them actively or attack them.

example.ex: The teenage attackers fled when the two men fought back...
example.tran: 当那两名男子还击时，袭击他们的少年逃之夭夭。

example.ex: We should take some comfort from the ability of the judicial system to fight back against corruption.
example.tran: 司法制度有能力惩治腐败，这应使我们感到些许欣慰。

entry.def: If you fight back an emotion or a desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it.
entry.tran: 强忍住，抑制住(感情或欲望)

example.ex: She fought back the tears.
example.tran: 她强忍住眼泪。

entry.def: If you fight down an emotion or a desire, you try very hard not to feel it, show it, or act on it.
entry.tran: 强忍住，抑制住(感情或欲望)

example.ex: Meg fought down the desire to run...
example.tran: 梅格极力忍住不跑。

example.ex: He looked at the telephone, fighting down first the despair and then the anger.
example.tran: 他看着电话，把绝望和愤怒一一压下。

entry.def: If you fight off something, for example an illness or an unpleasant feeling, you succeed in getting rid of it and in not letting it overcome you.
entry.tran: 抵抗，战胜(疾病);摆脱(不快)

example.ex: Unfortunately these drugs are quite toxic and hinder the body's ability to fight off infection...
example.tran: 可惜的是，这些药物毒性很大，会削弱身体对感染的抵抗力。

example.ex: All day she had fought off the impulse to telephone Harry.
example.tran: 她一整天都在克制自己想给哈里打电话的冲动。

entry.def: If you fight off someone who has attacked you, you fight with them, and succeed in making them go away or stop attacking you.

example.ex: The woman fought off the attacker.
example.tran: 这名女子打跑了袭击她的人。

entry.def: If two people or groups fight something out, they fight or argue until one of them wins.
entry.tran: 在…上一争高下;通过比出胜负解决

example.ex: Instead of retaliating, he walks away leaving his team-mates to fight it out...
example.tran: 他没有以牙还牙，而是径直走开，让队友去争出个结果。

example.ex: Malcolm continued to fight it out with Julien from his self-imposed exile in Paris.
example.tran: 马尔科姆自我放逐到了巴黎，但他继续要和朱利恩斗到底。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of fighting; any contest or struggle;

sentences.sentence: "a fight broke out at the hockey game"
"the unhappy couple got into a terrible scrap"
"a violent fight over the bill is expected in the Senate"
"the fight was on television last night"

means.word_mean: 4. a hostile meeting of opposing military forces in the course of a war;

sentences.sentence: "Grant won a decisive victory in the battle of Chickamauga"
"he lost his romantic ideas about war when he got into a real engagement"

means.word_mean: 1. be engaged in a fight; carry on a fight;

sentences.sentence: "The senator said he would oppose the bill"

means.word_mean: 3. make a strenuous or labored effort;

sentences.sentence: "She struggled for years to survive without welfare"

means.word_mean: 4. exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person; be an advocate for;

sentences.sentence: "The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English feohtan (verb), feoht(e), gefeoht (noun), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch vechten, gevecht and German fechten, Gefecht

sentences.cn: 战斗. 你可能会死,逃跑.至少能苟且偷生.年复一年.直到寿终正寝. 你们!
sentences.en: Fight and you may die. Run and you'll live at least a while.

sentences.en: We'll fight, not out of spite, for someone must stand up for what's right.

sentences.en: That's just the way you fight, like a catty , bitchy woman.

sentences.en: " It's true. Every time we fight, she bawls like a newborn. "

sentences.en: I had no quarrel with you but if you want to fight, let's go outside.

sentences.cn: 我们从不想和任何人吵架.

sentences.cn: 也是早上和你吵架但晚上和你做爱的人.

sentences.en: It is necessary for cohering public feeling and inspiring fighting will to cultivate and publicize models.

sentences.cn: 我总是要外界一些事情激起我心里的斗志.

sentences.cn: 很快它会失去斗志, 然后快乐的回返家里.

sentences.cn: 不该让步无斗志.

sentences.en: Delightingly, with your staunch perseverance and unyielding will to fight, again you smashed all the doubts.

sentences.en: He is always so pigheaded. The more difficulties he encounters, the more fighting spirit he has.

sentences.cn: 我们斗志昂扬.
sentences.en: Our fighting spirIt'soars aloft.

sentences.cn: 我们仍然充满斗志.
sentences.en: We still had plenty of fight in us.

sentences.cn: 因为倒下的只是你的身躯, 而永远不会是你的斗志.
sentences.en: Tumbling was your body, but never your will to fight.

sentences.cn: 你们球队的精神甚至激起了我的斗志.
sentences.en: The spirit of your ball team even arose my will to fight.

sentences.cn: 即使没有受伤的人, 他们也好几天都丧失了斗志.
sentences.en: Even if they were uninjured, their fighting spirit was shattered for days.

sentences.cn: 但是曼联斗志旺盛,并且很自信,因为马切达的进球,他们得到了他们想要的.
sentences.en: But United kept fighting and believing and they got their reward with Macheda's goal.

sentences.cn: 他现在已经没剩下多少斗志了.
sentences.en: There's not much fight left in him now.

sentences.cn: 看到了火箭的血性,团结斗志希望.
sentences.en: Fight for another winGo go go, Rockets!

sentences.cn: 在对他们羡慕的同时我心中那股好强的斗志被猛烈的激起.
sentences.en: My admiration for them aroused the fight within me, a person always eager to outdo others.

sentences.cn: 他们斗志旺盛.
sentences.en: They have plenty of fight in them.

sentences.cn: 我们在赛场上斗志昂扬,他们不可能打败我们.
sentences.en: They couldn't defeat us because we were full of fight on the field.

sentences.cn: 从来还没有过这么好的鼓斗志的事.
sentences.en: Never was there such a spur for fighting.

sentences.cn: 部队瓦解了敌军的斗志.
sentences.en: The army paralyzed the enemy's fighting will.

sentences.cn: 虽然他们失败过很多次, 但仍然斗志昂扬.
sentences.en: In spite of numerous defeats, they still had plenty of fight left in them.

Sentence.sentence: The paper provides support for newer forms of psychotherapy (心理治疗) that urge people to accept their negative thoughts and feelings rather than fight them.

Sentence.sentence: Online programs to fight depression are already commercially available.

Sentence.sentence: Sleeping better may help fight off illness.

Sentence.sentence: So the job of the immune system is to fight infections.
